private_information: Expert in STRIPS-style action modeling and normalization
Maps natural-language preconditions and effects into canonical operator schemas
Resolves naming variations and aligns action symbols to PDDL-safe lowercase tokens
domain_modeler.goal: Extract a clean, normalized action model, predicate inventory, and object set from the public description to enable planning.

private_information: Parses scenario statements, initial conditions, and goals into structured state descriptions
Aligns scenarios to the canonical model, checking arities and object names
Prepares two scenario variants labeled A and B for downstream validation and planning
curator.goal: Compile the two scenario variants into structured initial states and goals that are consistent with the normalized model.

private_information: Audits temporal and causal consistency of plans against the model and scenarios
Detects and removes bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or magical state changes
Ensures that every action application is justified by currently true preconditions and tracks add-delete effects faithfully
auditor.goal: Audit the provided plan for Scenario A and the feasibility of Scenario B using the normalized model and scenarios; report inconsistencies and required corrections.

private_information: Coordinates the other agents and integrates their outputs
Generates a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver using the cleaned model and curated scenario
Keeps actions and predicates consistent and resolves remaining ambiguities
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the normalized model and audited scenarios to produce the final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem instance for Scenario B targeting the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Domain summary: You interact with a set of objects using six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates and arities: hand(x); cats(x); sneeze(x); spring(x); stupendous(x); texture(x); collect(x,y); next(x,y); vase(x,y).
Action paltry(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0; cats o1; texture o2; vase o0 o1; next o1 o2. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: vase o0 o1.
Action sip(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0; cats o1; texture o2; next o0 o2; next o1 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects delete: next o0 o2.
Action clip(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0; sneeze o1; texture o2; next o1 o2; next o0 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects delete: next o0 o2.
Action wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3) preconditions: sneeze o0; texture o1; texture o2; stupendous o3; next o0 o1; collect o1 o3; collect o2 o3. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: next o0 o1.
Action memory(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: cats o0; spring o1; spring o2; next o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0; sneeze o1; texture o2; next o1 o2; vase o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: vase o0 o1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_9; next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_9; next object_13 object_6; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario A goal facts: next object_10 object_6; next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_7; next object_13 object_9.

Scenario A candidate plan steps in order: clip object_12 object_5 object_9; clip object_10 object_5 object_9; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; clip object_11 object_5 object_8; memory object_1 object_6 object_8; paltry object_13 object_1 object_8; clip object_13 object_5 object_8; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_8; tightfisted object_10 object_5 object_8; wretched object_5 object_8 object_9 object_3; tightfisted object_13 object_5 object_9; tightfisted object_11 object_5 object_9; sip object_12 object_1 object_8; sip object_10 object_1 object_8; memory object_1 object_8 object_6; paltry object_12 object_1 object_6; paltry object_10 object_1 object_6; wretched object_4 object_7 object_6 object_2; clip object_12 object_4 object_6; wretched object_4 object_6 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_7.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_8; next object_1 object_8; next object_10 object_7; next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_8; next object_13 object_9; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario B goal facts: next object_10 object_6; next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_7; next object_13 object_9.
Scenario B plan is to be synthesized.

extract_model.system_prompt: You convert informal action descriptions into a normalized STRIPS-like action model. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a concise, unambiguous model containing: a lowercase predicate inventory with arities; action schemas with parameters, preconditions, add and delete lists; and a canonical list of objects. Keep naming consistent and PDDL-safe.
extract_model.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. Read the public information and derive a normalized model that captures the six actions and the predicates. Keep action names lowercase (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted). Ensure preconditions and effects match exactly what is stated. Provide your result as a compact JSON-like block with keys: predicates, actions, objects.

compile_scenarios.system_prompt: You compile scenario data into structured initial states and goals aligned to the provided model. Do not emit PDDL. Verify arities and object names, and provide two variants labeled A and B. If symbols in the scenarios need normalization, align them to the model while preserving meaning.
compile_scenarios.prompt: Your name is curator. Using the model and the public information, produce structured initial states and goals for Scenario A and Scenario B. Include: objects, init (as a flat list of grounded atoms), goal (as a flat list of grounded atoms). Keep everything consistent with the model_spec.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You audit causal and temporal consistency without shortcuts. For Scenario A, check each step against the current state: preconditions must be true before application; apply add and delete effects faithfully. Identify any violations, unreachable steps, or unnecessary cycles. For Scenario B, assess feasibility and note critical preconditions or enabling steps likely required. Do not emit PDDL.
audit_plan.prompt: Your name is auditor. Using model_spec and scenarios_spec, verify the Scenario A plan step by step and report inconsistencies, missing links, or contradictions. Also summarize readiness for Scenario B and any constraints that the orchestrator must respect. Remove any bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure effects are only produced via valid actions.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning integration. Using the normalized model and audited scenarios, generate a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Use a clean STRIPS domain compatible with FastDownward. Ensure object lists, initial facts, and goals come from Scenario B, reflect any auditor corrections, and that predicate and action names are lowercase and consistent.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Produce the final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance for Scenario B. Keep actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with their exact preconditions and effects. Use the objects and initial facts from Scenario B and the Scenario B goals. Target the FastDownward solver. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem> tags.
